I am a big fan of the half life series and I liked loved the original games, liked episode 1 and loved episode 2, but this was just unecessary. I get that it was made to demonstrate the first instance of high dynamic range rendering, but it should have been a free mod and not a payed dlc. It really felt pointless to me to be honest.

Interesting little tech demo for Valve.
I wouldn't really recommend it unless you're REALLY into Half Life 2 and want to see all the content ever produced for it. 
The tech is out of date now and exploration is rewarded with strange surrealistic vistas as you walk behind buildings, float under solid rocks, and jump through piers and bridges that look solid and totally aren't solid. 
The tech demo is designed to be played a very specific way, which is problematic when you don't see the path you're supposed to follow immediately. While my walk behind the post apocalyptic scenery was quite relaxing until I fell through what I thought was a solid object, I don't think I'll be playing it again, as I'm not super interested in the commentary track. It has virtually no replay value. It was designed as a showpiece for graphics and it remains as a relic of video game history, but not a particularly interesting one unless, like I said, you're REALLY into Half Life 2 and want to see all the content ever produced for it.

Half-Life 2: Lost Coast — распространяемый в составе комплектов Half-Life Complete и Valve Complete Pack уровень к игре Half-Life 2, выпущенный Valve Corporation через Steam в виде отдельной игры.

Данная игра простая в плане событий, Гордон Фримен очнулся по среди пляжа у разбитого корабля, и у неких ворот далее стоит рыбак и говорит, что нужно сделать, а именно - уничтожить базу комбайнов и миномёт. Идея простая и игровой процесс тоже простой, но увлекательный, ведь это Half-Life 2. Тут даже стрельба интересная.

Игра имеет чуть более детализированные модели, HDR, комментарии разработчиков.
Игра короткая, максимум на час, но с неё можно найти смешные моменты в виде недочётов в картостроении. Например, на одном из уступов, если ювелирно спрыгнуть, то в этом месте вода не убьёт и вдоль скалы, можно зайти за уровень и край земли.

Вердикт: Недостатков очень мало, после прохождения оригинальной Half-Life 2 рекомендую пройти. Качество и со вкусом, как раньше VALVe делала!

Not really a game, kind of a representation I guess. That "game" is just here to exist. I've "completed" it and I still dont understand what I've played.

I received this for free a long time ago and decided to play it after finishing Half Life 2 for the second time; the first time I finished it in the year of release.

It includes one level that takes place between two levels in the original game, it's purpose at the time was to display HDR and bloom effects. It's more of a showcase, if anything.

The level in itself is quite enjoyable, the graphics aged very well and it is packed with good ol' HL action as we know it. It is, as expected, rather short.

I wouldn't fork over at full price, but neither at a sale unless you really want to savour a bit more HL 2 in your life.

A fun little tech demo/cut Half-Life 2 level. Not really much to say. If you enjoy Half-Life 2 combat, then this is a short (no more than an hour depending on how quick or slow you take it) level to play through.

Realmente no aporta nada a la historia de half-life más que un escenario corto que eliminaron de su segunda entrega. A la hora de jugarlo, que no te va a llevar más de 10 minutos si no te detenes, te da la opción de hacerlo con o sin los comentarios de los desarrolladores. En el caso de hacerlo sin estos, es un simple escenario más, nada sorprendente. Sin embargo, al que le interese oír lo que tienen para decir quienes estuvieron detrás del half-life 2, lo veo cómo algo interesante para saber más a detalle cómo se lograron algunas cuestiones respecto a su apartado gráfico, escuchando cómo incorporaron el HDR y que cosas tuvieron en cuenta. Lo recomiendo para quien este aburrido y solo, escuchas las voces de algunos tipos hablando de términos tal vez desconocidos, y de paso te permite dar una idea muy por encima de la cantidad de factores que realmente hay que tener en cuenta para desarrollar un juego.
Pretty cool insight into some of Valve's development and it is playable.
good and short benchmark for old PCs / Retro gaming

I always heard praise for HL2 and it's Episodes but this is bizarre. There is hardly any content, and this feels like a tutorial. Throughout the single, yes SINGLE, level there are bubbles you have to listen to that tell you boring technical stuff. This is what HL2 is supposed to be? You talk to some stupid farmer or something and some guy talks about his face the whole time and he says clone troopers and the SWAT team are in the fortress above. You go there and basically have free aim to kill anyone as long as you don't use a bubble.
You go the the castle and again do the same, there is a bunch of crappy paintings everywhere and the SWAT guys and stormtroopers attack you, and later a helicopter does. Confusing and stupid, a waste of your time.
